The most economical and time-saving travel mode in Baoji is likely to be taking the bus. Buses in Baoji are affordable and run frequently, making it an accessible mode of transportation for tourists. Here is a sample tour plan for your first day in Baoji, using the bus:

10:00 AM - 12:00 PM: Visit the Baoji Bronze Museum. You can take bus No. 1 or No. 5 from the city center to the museum. The journey takes about 30 minutes.

1:00 PM - 2:00 PM: Have lunch at a local restaurant. There are many restaurants near the museum that serve traditional Shaanxi cuisine.

2:00 PM - 4:00 PM: Visit People's Park. You can take bus No. 1 or No. 5 from the museum to the park. The journey takes about 15 minutes.

4:00 PM - 6:00 PM: Visit the Han Yangling Mausoleum. You can take bus No. K5 from the city center to the mausoleum. The journey takes about 45 minutes.

7:00 PM - 8:30 PM: Enjoy a traditional Shaanxi performance or show. There are many theaters and performance venues in Baoji that offer traditional Shaanxi music and dance performances. You can take the bus to reach the theater.

This plan assumes you will be taking a 2-hour lunch break, which is a common practice in China. The exact schedule can be adjusted based on your interests, energy levels, and other factors. You can also add or remove activities based on your preferences, or extend your visits at any of the destinations.

Please note that these are just suggestions and can be adjusted based on your specific needs and interests. Additionally, the opening and closing times of the attractions, the performance schedules, and the public transportation schedules may change, so it's best to check in advance or with your hotel to confirm.
